abstract: Sierra Leone makes push to eradicate Ebola by confining population to their homes for three days, with exceptions for religious services, while thousands of teams search for cases.
lead_paragraph: Sierra Leone’s six million people were told on Friday to stay home for three days, except to attend religious services, as the West African nation attempted a final push to rid itself of Ebola.

headline.main: Sierra Leone: Citizens Told to Stay Home to Halt Ebola
headline.print_headline: Africa; Sierra Leone: Citizens Told to Stay Home to Halt Ebola

snippet: Sierra Leone’s six million people were told on Friday to stay home for three days, except to attend religious services, as the West African nation attempted a final push to rid itself of Ebola.
